column1: 1,The third-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the majority. The second-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the minority. The first-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking.,A. A. Milne
2,History teaches us that men and nations behave wisely once they have exhausted all other alternatives.,Abba Eban
3,"How many legs does a dog have, if you call the tail a leg? Four. Calling a tail a leg doesn't make it a leg.",Abraham Lincoln
4,"Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.",Abraham Lincoln
5,"When I do good, I feel good
column2: when I do bad, I feel bad, and that is my religion.",Abraham Lincoln

column1: 6,Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak out and remove all doubt.,Abraham Lincoln
7,"You can fool some of the people all of the time, and all of the people some of the time, but you can not fool all of the people all of the time.",Abraham Lincoln
8,"To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail.",Abraham Maslow
9,My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.,Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.
10,I use emotion for the many and reserve reason for the few.,Adolf Hitler
11,It is always more difficult to fight against faith than against knowledge.,Adolf Hitler
12,"Do not look where you fell, but where you slipped.",African proverb
13,Do you realize if it weren't for Edison we'd be watching TV by candlelight?,Al Boliska
14,Any company large enough to have a research lab is too large to listen to it.,Alan Kay
15,Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.,Albert Einstein
16,Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.,Albert Einstein
17,Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.,Albert Einstein
18,"Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.",Albert Einstein
19,A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.,Albert Einstein

20,"Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we now know and understand, while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand.",Albert Einstein
21,"When you look at yourself from a universal standpoint, something inside always reminds or informs you that there are bigger and better things to worry about.",Albert Einstein
22,The only thing that interferes with my learning is my education.,Albert Einstein
23,The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.,Albert Einstein
24,The person who reads too much and uses his brain too little will fall into lazy habits of thinking.,Albert Einstein
25,Time and space are modes by which we think and not conditions in which we live.,Albert Einstein
26,"When you sit with a nice girl for two hours, you think it's only a minute. But when you sit on a hot stove for a minute, you think it's two hours. That's  relativity.",Albert Einstein
27,"There are people who, instead of listening to what is being said to them, are already listening to what they are going to say themselves.",Albert Guinon
28,"When everyone is against you, it means that you are absolutely wrong-- or absolutely right.",Albert Guinon
29,An intellectual is a person who has discovered something more interesting than sex.,Aldous Huxley
30,"Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.",Alexander Pope
31,Do not confuse motion and progress. A rocking horse keeps moving but does not make any progress.,Alfred A. Montapert
32,It is easier to fight for one's principles than to live up to them.,Alfred Adler
33,The point of quotations is that one can use another's words to be insulting.,Amanda Cross
34,"Acquaintance, n.: A person whom we know well enough to borrow from, but not well enough to lend to.",Ambrose Bierce
35,"Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgement that something else is more important than fear.",Ambrose Redmoon
36,We don't see things as they are. We see things as we are.,Anais Nin
37,It is better to fail at your own life than to succeed at someone else's.,Andr̩ Gide
38,People cannot discover new lands until they have the courage to lose sight of the shore.,Andr̩ Gide
39,Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.,Andr̩ Gide
40,It is bad luck to be superstitious.,Andrew W. Mathis
41,If the lessons of history teach us anything it is that nobody learns the lessons that history teaches us.,Anon
42,"Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.",Antoine de Saint-Exup̩ry
43,"What lies in our power to do, lies in our power not to do.",Aristotle
44,It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.,Aristotle
45,"We are what we repeatedly do
column2: excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.",Aristotle

column1: 46,Talent hits a target no one else can hit
column2: Genius hits a target no one else can see.,Arthur Schopenhauer

column1: 47,"All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.",Arthur Schopenhauer
48,"Every nation ridicules other nations, and all are right.",Arthur Schopenhauer
49,I'd rather live with a good question than a bad answer.,Aryeh Frimer
50,The Argument from Intimidation is a confession of intellectual impotence.,Ayn Rand
51,The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do.,B. F. Skinner
52,A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.,Baltasar Gracian
53,"Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.",Barry LePatner
54,A government that is big enough to give you all you want is big enough to take it all away.,Thomas Jefferson
55,Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the men of old
56,Trying to determine what is going on in the world by reading newspapers is like trying to tell the time by watching the second hand of a clock.,Ben Hecht
57,"Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for truth.",Benjamin Disraeli
58,Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.,Benjamin Franklin
59,The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goals to reach.,Benjamin Mays
60,What happens to the hole when the cheese is gone?,Bertolt Brecht
61,"The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.",Bertrand Russell
62,No one gossips about other people's secret virtues.,Bertrand Russell

63,"If a man is offered a fact which goes against his instincts, he will scrutinize it closely, and unless the evidence is overwhelming, he will refuse to believe it. If, on the other hand, he is offered something which affords a reason for acting in accordance to his instincts, he will accept it even on the slightest evidence. The origin of myths is explained in this way.",Bertrand Russell
64,The greatest challenge to any thinker is stating the problem in a way that will allow a solution.,Bertrand Russell
65,"I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.",Bill Cosby
66,"If at first you don't succeed, find out if the loser gets anything.",Bill Lyon
67,"Thought is useful when it motivates for action, and a hindrance when it substitutes for action.",Bill Raeder
68,An optimist stays up to see the New Year in. A pessimist waits to make sure the old one leaves.,Bill Vaughan
69,"We learn something every day, and lots of times it's that what we learned the day before was wrong.",Bill Vaughan
70,Careful. We don't want to learn from this.,Bill Watterson
71,I really wish I was less of a thinking man and more of a fool not afraid of rejection.,Billy Joel
72,I have made this letter longer than usual because I lack the time to make it shorter.,Blaise Pascal
73,A single question can be more influential than a thousand statements.,Bo Bennett
74,A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.,Bob Hope
75,"The less you know, the more you believe.",Bono
76,When the student is ready the teacher will appear.,Buddhist Proverb
77,"Don't ever wrestle with a pig. You'll both get dirty, but the pig will enjoy it.",Cale Yarborough
78,The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found. ,Calvin Trillin
79,Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.,Carl Jung

80,"Just the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown.",Carl Sagan
81,"Some people make things happen, some people watch things happen, and some ask what happened.",Casey Stengel
82,"If you can't be a good example, then you'll just have to be a horrible warning.",Catherine Aird
83,You don't get anything clean without getting something else dirty.,Cecil Baxter
84,Happiness is the absence of striving for happiness.,Chang-Tzu
85,"Fight for your opinions, but do not believe that they contain the whole truth, or the only truth.",Charles A. Dana
86,The difference between a democracy and a dictatorship is that in a democracy you vote first and take orders later
column2: in a dictatorship you don't have to waste your time voting.,Charles Bukowski

column1: 87,An inventor is simply a fellow who doesn't take his education too seriously.,Charles F. Kettering
88,"Bureaucrats write memoranda both because they appear to be busy when they are writing and because the memos, once written, immediately become proof that they were busy.",Charles Peters
89,"By the time a man realizes that maybe his father was right, he usually has a son who thinks he's wrong.",Charles Wadsworth
90,"He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.",Chinese Proverb
91,One dog barks at something. And a hundred dogs bark at the sound.,Chinese Proverb
92,I hear: I forget / I see: I remember / I do: I understand,Chinese Proverb
93,Asking a working writer what he thinks about critics is like asking a lamppost how it feels about dogs.,Christopher Hampton
94,There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.,Christopher Morley
95,Inspiration is for amateurs. I just get to work.,Chuck Close
96,"In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice
97,When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President. Now I'm beginning to believe it.,Clarence Darrow
98,Laughing at our mistakes can lengthen our own life. Laughing at someone else's can shorten it.,Cullen Hightower
99,There are many who dare not kill themselves for fear of what the neighbors will say.,Cyril Connolly
100,"Better to write for yourself and have no public, than to write for the public and have no self.",Cyril Connolly
101,Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.,Dale Carnegie
102,"Never be afraid to laugh at yourself, after all, you could be missing out on the joke of the century.",Dame Edna Everage
103,Do not condemn the judgement of another because it differs from your own. You may both be wrong.,Dandemis
104,The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.,Daniel J. Boorstin
105,Procastination is not about not doing is about not doing and feeling crappy.,David Allen
106,"You can do anything, but not everything.",David Allen
107,"It is said that power corrupts, but actually it's more true that power attracts the corruptible. The sane are usually attracted by other things than power.",David Brin
108,A committee can make a decision that is dumber than any of its members.,David Cobitz
109,"The direct use of force is such a poor solution to any problem, it is generally employed only by small children and large nations.",David Friedman
110,Television enables you to be entertained in your home by people you wouldn't have in your home.,David Frost
111,Don't be afraid to take a big step if one is indicated. You can't cross a chasm in two small jumps.,David Lloyd George
112,The tooth fairy teaches children that they can sell body parts for money.,David Richerby
113,"The more you know, the more you realise how much you don't know -- the less you know, the more you think you know.",David T. Freeman
114,"Simple, clear purpose and principles give rise to complex and intelligent behavior. Complex rules and regulations give rise to simple and stupid behavior. ",Dee Hock
115,The first step toward success will be the biggest one.,Dennis Waitley
116,There's so much comedy on television. Does that cause comedy in the streets?,Dick Cavett
117,It's a rare person who wants to hear what he doesn't want to hear.,Dick Cavett
118,"If your parents never had children, chances are you won't, either.",Dick Cavett
119,There is nobody so irritating as somebody with less intelligence and more sense than we have.,Don Herold
120,Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.,Don Marquis
121,"If you are not criticized, you may not be doing much.",Donald H. Rumsfeld
122,The art of simplicity is a puzzle of complexity.,Doug Horton
123,"Instead of giving a politician the keys to the city, it might be better to change the locks.",Doug Larson
124,I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.,Douglas Adams
125,"Hofstadter's Law: It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take into account Hofstadter's Law.",Douglas Hofstadter
126,In God we trust
column2: all others bring data.,Dr. Edwards Deming

column1: 127,"Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.",Dr. Seuss
128,The best car safety device is a rear-view mirror with a cop in it.,Dudley Moore
129,"In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.",Dwight D. Eisenhower
130,I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve (or save) the world and a desire to enjoy (or savor) the world. This makes it hard to plan the day.,E. B. White
131,Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.,E. W. Dijkstra
132,I am patient with stupidity but not with those who are proud of it.,Edith Sitwell
133,If only we'd stop trying to be happy we could have a pretty good time.,Edith Wharton
134,Talent does what it can
column2: genius does what it must.,Edward Bulwer-Lytton

column1: 135,Just because your voice reaches halfway around the world doesn't mean you are wiser than when it reached only to the end of the bar.,Edward R. Murrow
136,The skill of writing is to create a context in which other people can think.,Edwin Schlossberg
137,No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.,Eleanor Roosevelt

138,"Normal is getting dressed in clothes that you buy for work and driving through traffic in a car that you are still paying for - in order to get to the job you need to pay for the clothes and the car, and the house you leave vacant all day so you can afford to live in it.",Ellen Goodman
139,The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.,Ellen Parr
140,I don't know anything about music. In my line you don't have to.,Elvis Presley
141,"If the human mind was simple enough to understand, we'd be too simple to understand it.",Emerson Pugh
142,"If voting changed anything, they'd make it illegal.",Emma Goldman
143,There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.,Epitectus
144,You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.,Eric Hoffer
145,"When people are free to do as they please, they usually imitate each other.",Eric Hoffer
146,The opposite of the religious fanatic is not the fanatical atheist but the gentle cynic who cares not whether there is a god or not.,Eric Hoffer
147,Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.,Erica Jong
148,Courage is grace under pressure.,Ernest Hemingway
149,You can't get away from yourself by moving from one place to another. There's nothing to that.,Ernest Hemingway
150,"A happy life is just a string of happy moments. But most people don't allow the happy moment, because they're so busy trying to get a happy life.",Esther Hicks
151,"Being in politics is like being a football coach. You have to be smart enough to understand the game, and dumb enough to think it's important.",Eugene McCarthy
152,Character is what you have left when you've lost everything you can lose.,Evan Esar
153,America believes in education: the average professor earns more money in a year than a professional athlete earns in a whole week.,Evan Esar
154,We confess our little faults to persuade people that we have no large ones.,Francois de La Rochefoucauld
155,"Watch your thoughts
Watch your words
Watch your actions
Watch your habits
Watch your character
156,We should be taught not to wait for inspiration to start a thing. Action always generates inspiration. Inspiration seldom generates action.,Frank Tibolt
157,Writing about music is like dancing about architecture.,Frank Zappa
158,The trouble with being punctual is that nobody's there to appreciate it.,Franklin P. Jones
159,Experience is that marvelous thing that enables you to recognize a mistake when you make it again.,Franklin P. Jones
160,"A celebrity is a person who works hard all his life to become well known, then wears dark glasses to avoid being recognized.",Fred Allen
161,"Insanity in individuals is something rare - but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.",Friedrich Nietzsche
162,The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.,Friedrich Nietzsche
163,Education... has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading.,G. M. Trevelyan
164,"I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use. ",Galileo Galilei
165,I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.,Galileo Galilei
166,You must be the change you wish to see in the world.,Gandhi
167,My friends tell me I have an intimacy problem. But they don't really know me.,Garry Shandling
168,I've been trying for some time to develop a lifestyle that doesn't require my presence.,Gary Trudeau
169,Everyone is a genius at least once a year. The real geniuses simply have their bright ideas closer together.,Georg Christoph Lichtenberg
170,My way of joking is to tell the truth. It is the funniest joke in the world.,George Bernard Shaw
171,The fact that a believer is happier than a skeptic is no more to the point than the fact that a drunken man is happier than a sober one.,George Bernard Shaw
172,Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all other countries because you were born in it.,George Bernard Shaw
173,Too bad the only people who know how to run the country are busy driving cabs and cutting hair.,George Burns
174,You know you're getting old when you stop to tie your shoelaces and wonder what else you could do while you're down there.,George Burns
175,"It takes only one drink to get me drunk. The trouble is, I can't remember if it's the thirteenth or the fourteenth.",George Burns
176,Are people more violently opposed to fur rather than leather because its much easier to harass rich women than motorcycle gangs?,George Carlin
177,The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised.,George F. Will
178,All animals are equal but some animals are more equal than others.,George Orwell
179,Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.,George Santayana
180,A physicist is an atom's way of knowing about atoms.,George Wald
181,I have too much respect for the idea of God to make it responsible for such an absurd world.,Georges Duhamel
182,Some people like my advice so much that they frame it upon the wall instead of using it.,Gordon R. Dickson
183,"2 is not equal to 3, not even for large values of 2.",Grabel's Law
184,Those are my principles. If you don't like them I have others.,Groucho Marx
185,A child of five would understand this. Send someone to fetch a child of five.,Groucho Marx
186,There is no truth. There is only perception.,Gustave Flaubert
187,All men are frauds. The only difference between them is that some admit it. I myself deny it.,H. L. Mencken
188,"There is a great difference between worry and concern. A worried person sees a problem, and a concerned person solves a problem.",Harold Stephens
189,"I once wanted to become an atheist, but I gave up - they have no holidays.",Henny Youngman
190,My Grandmother is over eighty and still doesn't need glasses. Drinks right out of the bottle.,Henny Youngman
191,"Think like a man of action, act like a man of thought.",Henri Bergson
192,"Science is facts
column2: just as houses are made of stones, so is science made of facts
column3: but a pile of stones is not a house and a collection of facts is not necessarily science.",Henri Poincare

column1: 193,Truly great madness cannot be achieved without significant intelligence. ,Henrik Tikkanen
194,"Every generation laughs at the old fashions, but follows religiously the new.",Henry David Thoreau
195,A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone.,Henry David Thoreau
196,Whether you think you can or think you can't -- you are right.,Henry Ford
197,"Writing is good, thinking is better. Cleverness is good, patience is better",Hermann Hesse
198,"If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.",Hermann Hesse
199,The whole secret of life is to be interested in one thing profoundly and in a thousand things well.,Horace Walpole
200,Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.,Immanuel Kant
201,"If the doctor told me I had six minutes to live, I'd type a little faster.",Isaac Asimov
202,"Part of the inhumanity of the computer is that, once it is competently programmed and working smoothly, it is completely honest.",Isaac Asimov
203,If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.,Isaac Newton
204,"Once the game is over, the King and the pawn go back in the same box.",Italian Proverb
205,"I don't deserve this award, but I have arthritis and I don't deserve that either.",Jack Benny
206,"I have enough money to last me the rest of my life, unless I buy something.",Jackie Mason
207,It's no longer a question of staying healthy. It's a question of finding a sickness you like.,Jackie Mason
208,"The world can only be grasped by action, not by contemplation.",Jacob Bronowski
209,Dream as if you'll live forever. Live as if you'll die today.,James Dean
210,Too many people are thinking of security instead of opportunity. They seem more afraid of life than death.,James F. Byrnes
211,A myth is a religion in which no one any longer believes.,James Feibleman
212,It is better to know some of the questions than all of the answers.,James Thurber
213,"He knows all about art, but he doesn't know what he likes.",James Thurber
214,"No matter what side of the argument you are on, you always find people on your side that you wish were on the other.",Jascha Heifetz
215,Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you is determinism
column2: the way you play it is free will.,Jawaharlal Nehru

column1: 216,Only the mediocre are always at their best.,Jean Giraudoux
